item.title: Convert
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

devenb123:

I need to convert this voting code from sixhundred sixty seven to 718. How can I go about converting this?

That’s still not specific enough. What base do you have, what base are you trying to convert to, if you try it now what happens? Do you have the database set up?

item.title: Convert

item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

devenb123:

Really? I want to convert this code to 718. It’s quite specific, how do i do it?

No… That isn’t specific at all. That’s like saying, “I want a good 317 server and client.”

item.title: Convert
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“devenb123, post:1, topic:471425”]Can someone help tell me how to convert this to 718?

public boolean checkVotes(String playerName) { try { String urlString = "http://rscalifornia.com/vote/vote.php?type=checkvote&username="+player.getDisplayName(); urlString = urlString.replaceAll(" ", "%20"); URL url = new URL(urlString); BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(url.openStream())); String results = reader.readLine(); if(results.length() > 0) { if(results.equals("user needs reward...")) return true; else return false; } } catch (MalformedURLException e) { System.out.println("Malformed URL Exception in checkVotes(String playerName)"); } catch (IOException e) { System.out.println("IO Exception in checkVotes(String playerName)"); } return false; }[/quote]

Nope. That’s not nearly specific enough of a question.

Read full topic

item.title: Convert
item.dc:creator: @devenb123 devenb123
item.description:
@devenb123 wrote:

Can someone help tell me how to convert this to 718?

public boolean checkVotes(String playerName) { try { String urlString = "http://rscalifornia.com/vote/vote.php?type=checkvote&username="+player.getDisplayName(); urlString = urlString.replaceAll(" ", "%20"); URL url = new URL(urlString); BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(url.openStream())); String results = reader.readLine(); if(results.length() > 0) { if(results.equals("user needs reward...")) return true; else return false; } } catch (MalformedURLException e) { System.out.println("Malformed URL Exception in checkVotes(String playerName)"); } catch (IOException e) { System.out.println("IO Exception in checkVotes(String playerName)"); } return false; }
